title: How Tracey Cunningham Colored 17 Stars’ Hair For The Oscars
50 Beauty Products On Sale During Amazon Prime Day
description: Super Sale Alert: Products in this story may be marked down for Prime Day. Shop our full coverage of the event here — or, dive directly into the deals here.Amazon’s Prime Day starts today, and ICYMI: The deals are already shaping up to be bigger and better than ever. Prime Day is one of the biggest shopping events of the calendar year, and this year, the sale is lasting for an unprecedented four-day stretch from July 8-11. As always, it’s a smart time to buy things like TVs, household items, clothing, and accessories, but Prime Day also offers a unique opportunity to save on everyday essentials — including products in your beauty routine. What makes Prime Day’s beauty deals different from other beauty sales is the broad — bordering on encyclopedic — range of brands, including everything from drugstore staples to luxury labels. (Some names to get excited for: Sol de Janeiro, Nécessaire, Vacation, and Ouai, among many others.) To save you both time and money, we've done the legwork for you, corralling all the best Prime Day beauty deals to shop across makeup, hair, skincare, and more. Ahead, shop 50 beauty deals worth adding to your haul.At Refinery29, we’re here to help you navigate this overwhelming world of stuff. All our market picks are independently selected and curated by the editorial team. All product details reflect the price and availability at the time of publication. If you buy or click on something we link to on our site, Refinery29 may earn commission.For more can't-miss shopping stories delivered straight to your inbox, sign up for our Most Wanted newsletter. author: Karina Hoshikawa

title: 11 Double French Manicure Ideas That Are Cooler Than The Classic
description: While nail art trends come and go faster than you can say “glazed donut”, there is one nail look that never dwindles in popularity: the French manicure. New interpretations of this classic nail style emerge each season, like the “deconstructed” French manicure, micro French tips and the chic French fade. There’s no denying that this timeless style has to be one of the most versatile manicures to opt for. It’s this latest iteration of the French manicure that has really got us excited for our next salon appointment, though. Enter: the double French manicure. Also known as “floating French tips”, the double French follows the same arched style as the classic French manicure, but with two strips of color at the tip instead of the single strip of white. It provides the perfect opportunity to play with different shades and widths and is pretty straightforward to achieve in a salon, or even at home if you have a small nail art brush. “I think floating French tips really resonate because of their versatility,” explains Kirsten White, nail technician and CEO and founder of London Grace. “The negative space created by the design can showcase the natural nail while also adding a touch of colur in an interesting way. It’s the perfect nail art if you want your nails to make a statement and still look elegant.” Ahead, we’ve pulled together 11 of our favorite double French manicure ideas to inspire your next nail appointment. Golden Touch View this post on Instagram A post shared by Emma (@nails.byemmaess) The sliver of gold at the tips of this irregular French manicure by Emma, aka @nails.byemmaess, adds a subtle hint of sparkle. It’s a chic nod to the double French trend and an undeniable winner for wedding season. Ruby Red View this post on Instagram A post shared by Iram Shelton (@iramshelton) A glossy red polish always looks good — and it looks even better when used to create these beautiful floating French tips by nail artist Iram Shelton. Get the look at home with Sally Hansen Miracle Gel Nail Polish in Rhapsody Red, $12.99. Pastel Pop View this post on Instagram A post shared by The Nail Gal (@thenailgaledinburgh) Pastel minimalism is dominating in this summer’s biggest nail trends. These candy-colored tips by Zara at The Nail Gal look so good paired with a more dialed-down nude base. Neon Glow View this post on Instagram A post shared by Sadie J Nails (@sadiejnails) Proving that negative space manicures aren’t just for minimalists, this vibrant orange double French style by nail artist and content creator Sadie Jordan is so playful and perfect for sunshine season. China Glaze Nail Lacquer in Orange Knockout, $6.19, will help you recreate the look at home. If you prefer shorter nails, take inspiration from this neon orange and pastel blue combo by Lois Samantha. View this post on Instagram A post shared by Lois Samantha (@polishedbylolo) Electric Blue View this post on Instagram A post shared by Karma 💋 BRIGHTON NAIL ARTIST (@nailsby.karma) Floating French tips provide the perfect opportunity to experiment with nail polish shades that you might otherwise steer clear of. This ’80s-inspired cobalt blue nail art by Karma looks so crisp teamed with a simple nude base. Essie Butler Please, $10, is a great option if you want to try a similar color for yourself. Not sold on cobalt? The trend is equally as cute with baby blue, like these right angle tips by nail artist and educator Bryony Howell. View this post on Instagram A post shared by Bryony Howell (@gelsbybry) Technicolor Clash View this post on Instagram A post shared by Melanie Graves (@overglowedit) While a lot of the double French nail art looks leave some bare space between the lines, this one pairs a vibrant tip with a micro line of contrasting color for a kaleidoscopic effect. Look to Melanie Graves for inspiration. Monochrome Tips View this post on Instagram A post shared by Iram Shelton (@iramshelton) Why were French tips ever white when black looks this good? From the almond-shaped nails to the effortlessly sophisticated onyx double tips, this nail art by Iram Shelton is simple yet striking. For the perfect glossy black shade, try OPI Infinite Shine in Black Onyx, $11.99. Gilded Pine View this post on Instagram A post shared by Amy Le (@amyle.nails) This teeny-tiny line of gold would pair perfectly with basically any nail color, but these deep forest green tips are undeniably captivating. Take inspiration from nail artist Amy Le. Open Space View this post on Instagram A post shared by M e g (@gel.bymegan) Taking negative space to the extreme by bringing the second line of color down past the midpoint of the nail, these micro metallic lines by manicurist Megan prove that sometimes simple nail art can be the most impactful. Red Carpet Manicure Flash Glitter Special Effect Gel Polish, $10.99, will help you recreate this minimalist style at home. Rose Gold View this post on Instagram A post shared by Amy Le (@amyle.nails) There’s a cute preppiness to this double French look by Amy Le, where instead of leaving the floating gold lines blank, they’ve been filled with a pop of candy pink polish. Minimal Simplicity View this post on Instagram A post shared by KENZO NAIL STUDIO (@kenzonailstudio) Pared back and elegant, there’s no arguing with how stylish this simple take on floating French tips looks. Courtesy of Kenzo Nail Studio, it’s a graceful nod to the classic French manicure, but with a modern upgrade. All you need is a steady hand and an opaque white polish like Sally Hansen Insta Dry Nail Polish in White on Time, $5.99, to get the look on your own. This story was originally published on Refinery29 UK. Like what you see? How about some more R29 goodness, right here?Polka-Dot Nails Are Summer’s Sweetest Micro TrendThese Italian Summer Nail Ideas Are So DreamySorbet Nails Are The Cool-Girl Summer Mani Trend
author: Mica Ricketts

title: The Amazon Prime Day 2025 Beauty Deals Our Editors Are Shopping Today
description: Beauty lovers, it's time - Amazon Prime Day is here! The July 2025 Prime Day deals are even better this year, with four days of discounts - running today through July 11. The annual shopping event is packed with steep discounts on products in home, kitchen, tech, wellness, fashion, and (of course) beauty. As shopping experts and Prime Day pros, we understand how overwhelming it can be to scroll through all the offers and find the best deals, but there's no need to worry or stress - we're here to help. If you're looking for the best early deals on beauty products, we've got your back! Amazon Prime Day has no shortage of bang-for-your-buck beauty deals, including makeup, hair care, skin care, nail care, and body care, plus several editor-favorite picks from brands like Laneige, Color Wow, La Roche Posay, and Unite. This is your chance to stock up on beauty essentials on a budget or try something new without breaking the bank. Need a refill of face sunscreen for the summer? Are you considering adding a vitamin C serum to your skin-care routine? Or are you on the hunt for a new acne treatment? We found quality picks on a budget for all your beauty needs. Take advantage of hair tools at a discount so you can get those effortless, beachy waves, a glam blowout, or a frizz-free, sleek look right at home. Prime Day also offers plenty of makeup, body care, and nail must haves. Our Favorite Prime Day Beauty Deals to Shop For those who have dry skin: AmLactin Daily Nourish Body Lotion at $13, originally $25 For those who are looking for a great tinted sunscreen: Bliss Block Star SPF 30 Daily Tinted Sunscreen at $14, originally $25 For those who need an anti-humidity hair spray: Color Wow Dream Coat Supernatural Spray at $20, originally $28 For those who suffer from acne: Differin Acne Treatment Gel at $13, originally $16 Shop more of Popsugar's editor-curated Amazon Prime Day Sale picks and subscribe to our newsletter for more shopping recommendations. And, if you aren't already a Prime Member, you can sign up here. Update on July 8, 2025 at 5:00 PM ET: Updated prices and checked stock for all products.
author: Anvita Reddy

title: 6 Summer Haircuts That Are Heating Up Right Now
description: Piña coladas, pool floats, al fresco lunches - summer is all but the definition of low key, as are the haircut trends that tend to emerge each season. This year, the assemblage of up-and-coming styles is no exception, and they are the kind of chops that look good even if you do like getting caught in the rain. "The general vibe with haircuts this summer will be low maintenance and effortless," hairstylist Tauni Dawson says. That means lots of texture and movement - but very little upkeep post-cut. Translation: 'tis the season of easy, breezy summer haircuts. Looking for specific ideas to bring to your next salon appointment? We've asked the pros to identify the hands-down coolest summer haircuts you'll be seeing everywhere in the warmer months ahead - from the shag haircut to the "French" bob, and more - because everyone deserves something hot to look forward to . . . that doesn't require cooling down with an umbrella drink. Keep scrolling for more. Experts Featured in This Article Tauni Dawson is a hairstylist at Nine Zero One salon in Los Angeles. Rachel Lee is a hairstylist at Nova Arts Salon. Amy Abramite is a creative director and hairstylist at Maxine Salon in Chicago. Hayley Heckmann is a celebrity hairstylist and a Tresemme brand partner. His clients include Meghan Trainor, Sofia Richie, and more. Anya Martin is a hairstylist at Nova Arts Salon. Pedro Felix is a hairstylist at Nova Arts Salon.
author: Jessica Harrington
